course_title: Playing on the Big Stage: Histories of the Olympics and Paralympics

learning_outcomes.description: Exhibit a range of critical and reflective skills in relation to the historical, socio-cultural, political and economic aspects of the Olympic Games and the Paralympic Games.
To situate the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games in a broad historical and socio-cultural context.
To comprehend critical dimensions of the histories of the Olympic Games and the Paralympic Games.

assessments.task_description:
Four (4) multiple-choice-question tests will occur throughout the semester based on the lectures and discussions. Questions in the first quiz will be based on the lectures in the preceding weeks; questions in each subsequent quiz will be based on lectures held since the previous quiz.

Each quiz will contain 10 multiple choice questions that assess the student's knowledge and understanding of course content.

Students will have the opportunity to do a practice quiz in Week 3. No marks will be given for the practice quiz.

Use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) 

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: To be completed as an online quiz via the course Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description:
There are 3 parts to this task.

1.      First, create a reference list of ten (10) newspaper articles found on Trove (https://trove.nla.gov.au/) related to one of the following summer Olympic Games: 1912, 1920, 1928 or 1932. The articles must be from (i.e., published in) the year of the games; an article about the 1912 Games published in 1950, for example, is not acceptable. Use MLA Citation style (copy and paste directly from Trove).

2.      Second, create a reference list of five (5) books, book chapters, book sections, or academic journal articles on any one of the games listed above. Use MLA Citation style.

3.      Third, summarise the key argument or points made in five (5) of the newspaper articles in 100 words maximum each.

A template is provided for this task. Submission must be in Microsoft Word format and not as a pdf.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.
assessments.submission_guidelines: To be submitted via the relevant Turnitin submission portal on the course Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
The short-answer test will occur in class during the semester based on assigned readings (journal articles).

The test will contain two (2) short-answer questions, worth 10% each, that assess the student's knowledge and understanding of the assigned articles.

No phones, computers/laptops or earpieces can be used during the tests.

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: To be completed as an in-person paper-based examination.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.
